formattedAddress: Chambers & Greenwich, 167 Chambers St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: Chambers & Greenwich, 167 Chambers St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.

originalText.text: The food is usually good. The place is busy, so the food turns over quickly... Nothing sits around. The restaurant is pretty dirty because of the high volume of customers. They're out of ice pretty often. They don't seem to give out napkins regularly anymore. Air conditioning is non existent. I only go there because the next closest location is even dirtier.

text.text: The food is usually good. The place is busy, so the food turns over quickly... Nothing sits around. The restaurant is pretty dirty because of the high volume of customers. They're out of ice pretty often. They don't seem to give out napkins regularly anymore. Air conditioning is non existent. I only go there because the next closest location is even dirtier.

originalText.text: Stopped there to get my coffee (mobile order). They took a little while but made it good. They have a decent place to sit and enjoy your food. Staffs are seemed professional and efficient.

text.text: Stopped there to get my coffee (mobile order). They took a little while but made it good. They have a decent place to sit and enjoy your food. Staffs are seemed professional and efficient.

originalText.text: The lady at the delivery counter was too rude. The washroom was closed & i asked her regarding the same. She replied rudely, that the washroom remains closed . NOW ABOUT THE SAUCE? Where’s the sauce. Pictures for reference. The French Fries taste sour, must be stale. What else can we expect. Damn McD is doomed

text.text: The lady at the delivery counter was too rude. The washroom was closed & i asked her regarding the same. She replied rudely, that the washroom remains closed . NOW ABOUT THE SAUCE? Where’s the sauce. Pictures for reference. The French Fries taste sour, must be stale. What else can we expect. Damn McD is doomed

originalText.text:
I work in the area, and eat here the most. Most of the time I'm on break and I don't have a lot of time to eat and get back on the floor so I don't eat in.

This location is often busy but the staff is always working hard to get it done, and I appreciate the effort they're always showing to get the job done. Food is always good.

I use the app these days because McDonald's gives 'points' and deals, like currently on Friday you can get a free medium fries. When you order you need to have GPS on with the app open and having access, they won't be prompted to start the order until you are nearing the location. We need to take that up with corporate (given the fact I, for one, have already paid by then)

.

originalText.text: Tribeca Mickey Ds. it is a newer styled McDonalds with lots of seating, touchscreen kiosks, and a more modern vibe. grabbed coffee here, twice this winter. the service is kinda lackluster at best. employees seem like they do not want not to be at this location and it shows in the lack of energy from the jump as you enter. the mobile order pickup felt pretty disorganized. one time coffee was sitting for a bit before i asked for it and then an employee thought to check for it. another time, my order was made pretty sloppily and with minimal effort. this is pretty much the norm now post-pandemic -- lack of basic follow-through in service, product, etc. but hey it's "fast food" so who cares. as far as a McDonalds, it’s okay.
